articles.title: Russian APT Deploys New 'Kapeka' Backdoor in Eastern European Attacks

articles.description:

articles.title: Critical Atlassian Flaw Exploited to Deploy Linux Variant of Cerber Ransomware

articles.title: Hackers Exploit Fortinet Flaw, Deploy ScreenConnect, Metasploit in New Campaign

articles.title: AWS, Google, and Azure CLI Tools Could Leak Credentials in Build Logs

articles.author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
articles.description:
The maintainers of the PuTTY Secure Shell (SSH) and Telnet client are alerting users of a critical vulnerability impacting versions from 0.68 through 0.80 that could be exploited to achieve full recovery of NIST P-521 (ecdsa-sha2-nistp521) private keys.
The flaw has been assigned the CVE identifier CVE-2024-31497, with the discovery credited to researchers Fabian Bäumer and Marcus
articles.title: Widely-Used PuTTY SSH Client Found Vulnerable to Key Recovery Attack

articles.author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
